title: Chauka, Please Tell Us The Time
brief_description: An urgent and powerful documentary, secretly filmed on a phone inside the Manus Island detention centre, where asylum seekers trying to reach Australia are indefinitely detained, by Iranian Kurdish journalist Behrouz Boochani, in collaboration with Dutch Iranian filmmaker Arash Kamali Sarvestani.

constellations_primary.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_primary.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

description: An urgent and powerful documentary, shot in a detention centre where asylum seekers trying to reach Australian shores are indefinitely detained. Secretly shot on a mobile phone by Iranian Kurdish journalist Behrouz Boochani while detained on Manus, in Papua New Guinea, the film is a collaboration with Dutch Iranian filmmaker Arash Kamali Sarvestani. Boochani recounts, via the testimonies of fellow inmates, the abuse and violence inflicted and the precarious state of limbo they find themselves in. Chauka, the name of the dreaded solitary confinement unit within the detention centre, was originally the name of a beautiful bird and symbol of the Manus Island. By interweaving dialogue with two Manusian men and shots of daily life on the island, the film gives a much-needed voice to Manus inhabitants, understandably distressed by the current situation. With marked restraint, the film exposes lives broken by shocking immigration policies.
